intro: Barleria nutans, commonly known as the hanging barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in spikes, and range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive yellow center. Barleria nutans is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along roadsides.
